text:
Paul, an apostle of Christ Jesus by the will of God,
To the saints who are at Ephesus and who are faithful in Christ Jesus:
speaker: Narrator

text: Grace to you and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.
speaker: Narrator

text: Blessed be the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, who has blessed us with every spiritual blessing in the heavenly places in Christ,
speaker: Narrator

text: just as He chose us in Him before the foundation of the world, that we would be holy and blameless before Him. In love
speaker: Narrator

text: He predestined us to adoption as sons through Jesus Christ to Himself, according to the kind intention of His will,
speaker: Narrator

text: to the praise of the glory of His grace, which He freely bestowed on us in the Beloved.
speaker: Narrator

text: In Him we have redemption through His blood, the forgiveness of our trespasses, according to the riches of His grace
speaker: Narrator

text: which He lavished on us. In all wisdom and insight
speaker: Narrator

text: He made known to us the mystery of His will, according to His kind intention which He purposed in Him
speaker: Narrator

text: with a view to an administration suitable to the fullness of the times, that is, the summing up of all things in Christ, things in the heavens and things on the earth. In Him
speaker: Narrator

text: also we have obtained an inheritance, having been predestined according to His purpose who works all things after the counsel of His will,
speaker: Narrator

text: to the end that we who were the first to hope in Christ would be to the praise of His glory.
speaker: Narrator

text: In Him, you also, after listening to the message of truth, the gospel of your salvation—having also believed, you were sealed in Him with the Holy Spirit of promise,
speaker: Narrator

text: who is given as a pledge of our inheritance, with a view to the redemption of God’s own possession, to the praise of His glory.
speaker: Narrator

text: For this reason I too, having heard of the faith in the Lord Jesus which exists among you and your love for all the saints,
speaker: Narrator

text: do not cease giving thanks for you, while making mention of you in my prayers;
speaker: Narrator

text: that the God of our Lord Jesus Christ, the Father of glory, may give to you a spirit of wisdom and of revelation in the knowledge of Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: I pray that the eyes of your heart may be enlightened, so that you will know what is the hope of His calling, what are the riches of the glory of His inheritance in the saints,
speaker: Narrator

text: and what is the surpassing greatness of His power toward us who believe. These are in accordance with the working of the strength of His might
speaker: Narrator

text: which He brought about in Christ, when He raised Him from the dead and seated Him at His right hand in the heavenly places,
speaker: Narrator

text: far above all rule and authority and power and dominion, and every name that is named, not only in this age but also in the one to come.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He put all things in subjection under His feet, and gave Him as head over all things to the church,
speaker: Narrator

text: which is His body, the fullness of Him who fills all in all.
speaker: Narrator

text: And you were dead in your trespasses and sins,
speaker: Narrator

text: in which you formerly walked according to the course of this world, according to the prince of the power of the air, of the spirit that is now working in the sons of disobedience.
speaker: Narrator

text: Among them we too all formerly lived in the lusts of our flesh, indulging the desires of the flesh and of the mind, and were by nature children of wrath, even as the rest.
speaker: Narrator

text: But God, being rich in mercy, because of His great love with which He loved us,
speaker: Narrator

text: even when we were dead in our transgressions, made us alive together with Christ (by grace you have been saved),
speaker: Narrator

text: and raised us up with Him, and seated us with Him in the heavenly places in Christ Jesus,
speaker: Narrator

text: so that in the ages to come He might show the surpassing riches of His grace in kindness toward us in Christ Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: For by grace you have been saved through faith; and that not of yourselves, it is the gift of God;
speaker: Narrator

text: not as a result of works, so that no one may boast.
speaker: Narrator

text: For we are His workmanship, created in Christ Jesus for good works, which God prepared beforehand so that we would walk in them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore remember that formerly you, the Gentiles in the flesh, who are called “Uncircumcision” by the so-called “Circumcision,” which is performed in the flesh by human hands—
speaker: Narrator

text: remember that you were at that time separate from Christ, excluded from the commonwealth of Israel, and strangers to the covenants of promise, having no hope and without God in the world.
speaker: Narrator

text: But now in Christ Jesus you who formerly were far off have been brought near by the blood of Christ.
speaker: Narrator

text: For He Himself is our peace, who made both groups into one and broke down the barrier of the dividing wall,
speaker: Narrator

text: by abolishing in His flesh the enmity, which is the Law of commandments contained in ordinances, so that in Himself He might make the two into one new man, thus establishing peace,
speaker: Narrator

text: and might reconcile them both in one body to God through the cross, by it having put to death the enmity.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He came and preached peace to you who were far away, and peace to those who were near;
speaker: Narrator

text: for through Him we both have our access in one Spirit to the Father.
speaker: Narrator

text: So then you are no longer strangers and aliens, but you are fellow citizens with the saints, and are of God’s household,
speaker: Narrator

text: having been built on the foundation of the apostles and prophets, Christ Jesus Himself being the corner stone,
speaker: Narrator

text: in whom the whole building, being fitted together, is growing into a holy temple in the Lord,
speaker: Narrator

text: in whom you also are being built together into a dwelling of God in the Spirit.
speaker: Narrator

text: For this reason I, Paul, the prisoner of Christ Jesus for the sake of you Gentiles—
speaker: Narrator

text: if indeed you have heard of the stewardship of God’s grace which was given to me for you;
speaker: Narrator

text: that by revelation there was made known to me the mystery, as I wrote before in brief.
speaker: Narrator

text: By referring to this, when you read you can understand my insight into the mystery of Christ,
speaker: Narrator

text: which in other generations was not made known to the sons of men, as it has now been revealed to His holy apostles and prophets in the Spirit;
speaker: Narrator

text: to be specific, that the Gentiles are fellow heirs and fellow members of the body, and fellow partakers of the promise in Christ Jesus through the gospel,
speaker: Narrator

text: of which I was made a minister, according to the gift of God’s grace which was given to me according to the working of His power.
speaker: Narrator

text: To me, the very least of all saints, this grace was given, to preach to the Gentiles the unfathomable riches of Christ,
speaker: Narrator

text: and to bring to light what is the administration of the mystery which for ages has been hidden in God who created all things;
speaker: Narrator

text: so that the manifold wisdom of God might now be made known through the church to the rulers and the authorities in the heavenly places.
speaker: Narrator

text: This was in accordance with the eternal purpose which He carried out in Christ Jesus our Lord,
speaker: Narrator

text: in whom we have boldness and confident access through faith in Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore I ask you not to lose heart at my tribulations on your behalf, for they are your glory.
speaker: Narrator

text: For this reason I bow my knees before the Father,
speaker: Narrator

text: from whom every family in heaven and on earth derives its name,
speaker: Narrator

text: that He would grant you, according to the riches of His glory, to be strengthened with power through His Spirit in the inner man,
speaker: Narrator

text: so that Christ may dwell in your hearts through faith; and that you, being rooted and grounded in love,
speaker: Narrator

text: may be able to comprehend with all the saints what is the breadth and length and height and depth,
speaker: Narrator

text: and to know the love of Christ which surpasses knowledge, that you may be filled up to all the fullness of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now to Him who is able to do far more abundantly beyond all that we ask or think, according to the power that works within us,
speaker: Narrator

text: to Him be the glory in the church and in Christ Jesus to all generations forever and ever. Amen.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore I, the prisoner of the Lord, implore you to walk in a manner worthy of the calling with which you have been called,
speaker: Narrator

text: with all humility and gentleness, with patience, showing tolerance for one another in love,
speaker: Narrator

text: being diligent to preserve the unity of the Spirit in the bond of peace.
speaker: Narrator

text: There is one body and one Spirit, just as also you were called in one hope of your calling;
speaker: Narrator

text: one Lord, one faith, one baptism,
speaker: Narrator

text: one God and Father of all who is over all and through all and in all.
speaker: Narrator

text: But to each one of us grace was given according to the measure of Christ’s gift.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Therefore it says,
“When He ascended on high,
He led captive a host of captives,
And He gave gifts to men.”
speaker: Narrator

text: (Now this expression, “He ascended,” what does it mean except that He also had descended into the lower parts of the earth?
speaker: Narrator

text: He who descended is Himself also He who ascended far above all the heavens, so that He might fill all things.)
speaker: Narrator

text: And He gave some as apostles, and some as prophets, and some as evangelists, and some as pastors and teachers,
speaker: Narrator

text: for the equipping of the saints for the work of service, to the building up of the body of Christ;
speaker: Narrator

text: until we all attain to the unity of the faith, and of the knowledge of the Son of God, to a mature man, to the measure of the stature which belongs to the fullness of Christ.
speaker: Narrator

text: As a result, we are no longer to be children, tossed here and there by waves and carried about by every wind of doctrine, by the trickery of men, by craftiness in deceitful scheming;
speaker: Narrator

text: but speaking the truth in love, we are to grow up in all aspects into Him who is the head, even Christ,
speaker: Narrator

text: from whom the whole body, being fitted and held together by what every joint supplies, according to the proper working of each individual part, causes the growth of the body for the building up of itself in love.
speaker: Narrator

text: So this I say, and affirm together with the Lord, that you walk no longer just as the Gentiles also walk, in the futility of their mind,
speaker: Narrator

text: being darkened in their understanding, excluded from the life of God because of the ignorance that is in them, because of the hardness of their heart;
speaker: Narrator

text: and they, having become callous, have given themselves over to sensuality for the practice of every kind of impurity with greediness.
speaker: Narrator

text: But you did not learn Christ in this way,
speaker: Narrator

text: if indeed you have heard Him and have been taught in Him, just as truth is in Jesus,
speaker: Narrator

text: that, in reference to your former manner of life, you lay aside the old self, which is being corrupted in accordance with the lusts of deceit,
speaker: Narrator

text: and that you be renewed in the spirit of your mind,
speaker: Narrator

text: and put on the new self, which in the likeness of God has been created in righteousness and holiness of the truth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore, laying aside falsehood, speak truth each one of you with his neighbor, for we are members of one another.
speaker: Narrator

text: Be angry, and yet do not sin; do not let the sun go down on your anger,
speaker: Narrator

text: and do not give the devil an opportunity.
speaker: Narrator

text: He who steals must steal no longer; but rather he must labor, performing with his own hands what is good, so that he will have something to share with one who has need.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let no unwholesome word proceed from your mouth, but only such a word as is good for edification according to the need of the moment, so that it will give grace to those who hear.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not grieve the Holy Spirit of God, by whom you were sealed for the day of redemption.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let all bitterness and wrath and anger and clamor and slander be put away from you, along with all malice.
speaker: Narrator

text: Be kind to one another, tender-hearted, forgiving each other, just as God in Christ also has forgiven you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore be imitators of God, as beloved children;
speaker: Narrator

text: and walk in love, just as Christ also loved you and gave Himself up for us, an offering and a sacrifice to God as a fragrant aroma.
speaker: Narrator

text: But immorality or any impurity or greed must not even be named among you, as is proper among saints;
speaker: Narrator

text: and there must be no filthiness and silly talk, or coarse jesting, which are not fitting, but rather giving of thanks.
speaker: Narrator

text: For this you know with certainty, that no immoral or impure person or covetous man, who is an idolater, has an inheritance in the kingdom of Christ and God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let no one deceive you with empty words, for because of these things the wrath of God comes upon the sons of disobedience.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore do not be partakers with them;
speaker: Narrator

text: for you were formerly darkness, but now you are Light in the Lord; walk as children of Light
speaker: Narrator

text: (for the fruit of the Light consists in all goodness and righteousness and truth),
speaker: Narrator

text: trying to learn what is pleasing to the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not participate in the unfruitful deeds of darkness, but instead even expose them;
speaker: Narrator

text: for it is disgraceful even to speak of the things which are done by them in secret.
speaker: Narrator

text: But all things become visible when they are exposed by the light, for everything that becomes visible is light.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For this reason it says,
“Awake, sleeper,
And arise from the dead,
And Christ will shine on you.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore be careful how you walk, not as unwise men but as wise,
speaker: Narrator

text: making the most of your time, because the days are evil.
speaker: Narrator

text: So then do not be foolish, but understand what the will of the Lord is.
speaker: Narrator

text: And do not get drunk with wine, for that is dissipation, but be filled with the Spirit,
speaker: Narrator

text: speaking to one another in psalms and hymns and spiritual songs, singing and making melody with your heart to the Lord;
speaker: Narrator

text: always giving thanks for all things in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ to God, even the Father;
speaker: Narrator

text: and be subject to one another in the fear of Christ.
speaker: Narrator

text: Wives, be subject to your own husbands, as to the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the husband is the head of the wife, as Christ also is the head of the church, He Himself being the Savior of the body.
speaker: Narrator

text: But as the church is subject to Christ, so also the wives ought to be to their husbands in everything.
speaker: Narrator

text: Husbands, love your wives, just as Christ also loved the church and gave Himself up for her,
speaker: Narrator

text: so that He might sanctify her, having cleansed her by the washing of water with the word,
speaker: Narrator

text: that He might present to Himself the church in all her glory, having no spot or wrinkle or any such thing; but that she would be holy and blameless.
speaker: Narrator

text: So husbands ought also to love their own wives as their own bodies. He who loves his own wife loves himself;
speaker: Narrator

text: for no one ever hated his own flesh, but nourishes and cherishes it, just as Christ also does the church,
speaker: Narrator

text: because we are members of His body.
speaker: Narrator

text: For this reason a man shall leave his father and mother and shall be joined to his wife, and the two shall become one flesh.
speaker: Narrator

text: This mystery is great; but I am speaking with reference to Christ and the church.
speaker: Narrator

text: Nevertheless, each individual among you also is to love his own wife even as himself, and the wife must see to it that she respects her husband.
speaker: Narrator

text: Children, obey your parents in the Lord, for this is right.
speaker: Narrator

text: Honor your father and mother (which is the first commandment with a promise),
speaker: Narrator

text: so that it may be well with you, and that you may live long on the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Fathers, do not provoke your children to anger, but bring them up in the discipline and instruction of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Slaves, be obedient to those who are your masters according to the flesh, with fear and trembling, in the sincerity of your heart, as to Christ;
speaker: Narrator

text: not by way of eyeservice, as men-pleasers, but as slaves of Christ, doing the will of God from the heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: With good will render service, as to the Lord, and not to men,
speaker: Narrator

text: knowing that whatever good thing each one does, this he will receive back from the Lord, whether slave or free.
speaker: Narrator

text: And masters, do the same things to them, and give up threatening, knowing that both their Master and yours is in heaven, and there is no partiality with Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Finally, be strong in the Lord and in the strength of His might.
speaker: Narrator

text: Put on the full armor of God, so that you will be able to stand firm against the schemes of the devil.
speaker: Narrator

text: For our struggle is not against flesh and blood, but against the rulers, against the powers, against the world forces of this darkness, against the spiritual forces of wickedness in the heavenly places.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore, take up the full armor of God, so that you will be able to resist in the evil day, and having done everything, to stand firm.
speaker: Narrator

text: Stand firm therefore, having girded your loins with truth, and having put on the breastplate of righteousness,
speaker: Narrator

text: and having shod your feet with the preparation of the gospel of peace;
speaker: Narrator

text: in addition to all, taking up the shield of faith with which you will be able to extinguish all the flaming arrows of the evil one.
speaker: Narrator

text: And take the helmet of salvation, and the sword of the Spirit, which is the word of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: With all prayer and petition pray at all times in the Spirit, and with this in view, be on the alert with all perseverance and petition for all the saints,
speaker: Narrator

text: and pray on my behalf, that utterance may be given to me in the opening of my mouth, to make known with boldness the mystery of the gospel,
speaker: Narrator

text: for which I am an ambassador in chains; that in proclaiming it I may speak boldly, as I ought to speak.
speaker: Narrator

text: But that you also may know about my circumstances, how I am doing, Tychicus, the beloved brother and faithful minister in the Lord, will make everything known to you.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have sent him to you for this very purpose, so that you may know about us, and that he may comfort your hearts.
speaker: Narrator

text: Peace be to the brethren, and love with faith, from God the Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.
speaker: Narrator

text: Grace be with all those who love our Lord Jesus Christ with incorruptible love.
speaker: Narrator
